title: Higher-Order Thinking Development for Chemistry Education: GSS-Integrated Digital Learning Model and Socioscientific Problem-Solving Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemistry theory and experimental methodologies, basic proficiency with digital learning tools, foundational comprehension of social issues (history, geography, politics, culture, etc.), and basic awareness of citizen rights and institutional frameworks
context.additional_context: Learners are in-service professionals with chemistry field experience, studying in smartphone-limited environments. Formative assessment-centered with personalized feedback based on learning outcomes. Focuses on developing chemistry solutions considering community rights, institutions, and cultural contexts, exploring civic engagement and community relationship strengthening.

learning_goals: Apply GSS (General Science and Technology)-based analytical, evaluative, and creative skills to solve chemistry problems, integrating scientific inquiry methods and citizen participation strategies for societal issues.

Enhance the ability to critically analyze complex chemical phenomena using digital learning models, apply findings to social contexts (e.g., community conflict resolution), and propose institutional improvements.

Learners will understand 3 IBL-GSS (Inquiry-Based Learning-GSS) strategies (individual inquiry, collaborative inquiry, case-based inquiry) and apply ≥2 to a given social issue (e.g., community conflict resolution). They will produce an inquiry report (≥80% completeness) including social relations, citizen rights, institutional improvements, and cultural contexts.

resources: Digital resource packages by learner proficiency levels
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
